item.title: 绿色债务置换市场曾一度火爆，如今却在降温。
item.description: 新兴市场债券正日益具有吸引力。【原文：Emerging market bonds are increasingly attractive.】

item.title: 银行家推销新兴市场债务置换方案，在曾经火爆的市场遭遇阻力
item.description: 在规模虽小但利润丰厚的债务互换市场中，银行家们如今正努力完成交易。【原文：Bankers in the small but lucrative market for debt swaps are now struggling to complete deals.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚称欧盟甲烷法规将使炼油商石油成本增加13%
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司在本周欧盟领导人会议前警告称，欧盟旨在遏制强效温室气体甲烷排放的法规，可能使原油进口成本增加约13%，并对欧盟工业基础造成重创。【原文：European Union rules intended to curb emissions of methane, a potent greenhouse gas, could add about 13% to the cost of crude oil imports and deal a hammer blow to the bloc’s industrial base, Exxon Mobil Corp. warned ahead of a meeting of leaders this week.】

item.title: 美国撤回对IMF气候贷款的支持，遭贝森特猛烈抨击
item.description: 美国已停止在国际货币基金组织支持与气候相关的贷款项目，对先前支持的融资计划投下反对票或弃权票。此前特朗普政府已表明政策优先事项发生转变。【原文：The US has stopped supporting climate-linked lending at the International Monetary Fund, casting “no” votes or abstentions on financing programs it had previously backed, after the Trump administration signaled a shift in priorities.】

item.title: 南非三大主要城市遭遇供水短缺
item.description: 南非首都比勒陀利亚、商业中心约翰内斯堡和旅游胜地开普敦周二均遭遇缺水危机，凸显该国基础设施老化带来的持续挑战。【原文：South Africa’s capital Pretoria, commercial hub Johannesburg and tourism mecca Cape Town all experienced water shortages on Tuesday, highlighting ongoing challenges with the nation’s frayed infrastructure.】

item.title: 欧盟应放宽碳排放市场上限，关键议员表示
item.description: 欧盟议会最大党团的一名成员表示，欧盟碳市场的改革计划应放缓化工、水泥等行业的年度减排目标。【原文：The planned reform of the European Union’s carbon market should involve a slower annual pace of emissions reductions for industries from chemicals to cement, according to a member of the biggest political group in the bloc’s parliament.】

item.title: 英国太阳能拍卖创纪录，助推实现清洁电网目标
item.description: 英国政府最新举行的陆上风电和太阳能拍卖项目授予了6.2吉瓦的装机容量，助力其推进清洁电网计划，政府称该计划将降低电费账单。【原文：The UK government’s latest onshore-wind and solar auction awarded 6.2 gigawatts of capacity, helping it make headway on clean-grid plans that it says will bring down bills.】

item.title: 气候不作为使时尚业34%利润面临风险
item.description:
全球变暖的经济影响正变得越来越难以被企业高管忽视。【原文：

The financial implications of global warming are becoming increasingly difficult for corporate executives to ignore.

】

item.title: 美国环保署将废除标志性排放政策，实施重大政策回撤
item.description: 美国环境保护署计划本周废除一项政策，该政策为一系列温室气体排放监管法规提供了法律依据，标志着特朗普总统在应对气候变化斗争中退缩的最重要一步。【原文：The US Environmental Protection Agency plans this week to repeal a policy that provides the legal foundation for a raft of rules regulating greenhouse gas emissions, marking President Donald Trump’s most consequential retreat from the fight against climate change.】

item.title: 中国加强石油化工、铜业及航空业碳排放报告要求
item.description: 中国生态环境部要求石化厂、铜冶炼厂、航空公司等高污染企业上报排放数据，这是扩大全国碳市场的重要一步。【原文：The Chinese environment ministry has asked petrochemicals plants, copper smelters, airlines and other heavy polluters to report their emissions, a key step to expanding the nation’s carbon market.】

item.title: 联合国重要报告称全球经济过度追求增长正损害自然
item.description: 超过150个国家签署了这项研究【原文：More than 150 nations signed off on the study】

item.title: 150多个国家认同过度关注GDP损害自然
item.description:
各国批准了一份耗时三年完成的重要报告，该报告指出全球经济尚未充分计入生物多样性风险。【原文：

The nations signed off on a major report, three years in the making, that concluded the global economy isn’t adequately pricing in biodiversity risks. 

】

item.title: Climate Risk Threatens Credit Ratings for Dozens of Countries
item.description:
最新研究显示，易受极端天气影响的小国未来几年可能面临气候变化带来的最高主权风险。

【原文：

Small countries prone to extreme weather may face the highest sovereign risks from climate change in coming years, according to new research.

】

item.title: 南非农产品出口创历史新高，而美国出口量却暴跌
item.description: 2025年南非农产品出口额创下151亿美元的年度纪录，尽管下半年对美国的出口量大幅下滑。【原文：South African agricultural exports hit an annual record of $15.1 billion in 2025, even as shipments to the US slumped in the second half of the year.】

item.title: 九旬科学家仍在深潜，称深海采矿终将失败
item.description: 据一位全球最资深的海洋生物学家称，从深海海底提取金属的计划过于复杂且成本高昂，难以成功。【原文：Plans to extract metals from the deep seabed are too complex and costly to succeed, according to one of the world’s most experienced marine biologists.】

item.title: 日本最大核电站经历短暂停运后二度重启
item.description: 日本东京电力公司重启了全球最大核电站的一座反应堆，此前因上月出现问题导致重启进程延迟。【原文：Japanese utility Tokyo Electric Power Co. restarted a reactor at the world’s biggest nuclear power plant, after an issue last month delayed the process.】

item.title: 可再生能源合同待售 助推菲律宾严打行动
item.description: 许多在菲律宾赢得可再生能源项目合同的潜在投资者，根本无意实际建设这些项目。他们只是在等待时机，以合适的价格将这些项目权益转售给他人。【原文：Many prospective investors who won contracts for renewable energy projects in the Philippines had no plans of building them. They were only waiting to sell those rights to someone else for the right price.】

item.title: 新西兰筛选建设首座液化天然气进口设施的提案
item.description: 新西兰政府已就建设该国首个液化天然气进口设施的提案进行最终筛选，旨在增强能源安全并减少对污染性更强的化石燃料的依赖。【原文：The New Zealand government has shortlisted proposals to build the nation’s first liquefied natural gas import facility, as it seeks to bolster energy security and curb reliance on dirtier fossil fuels.】

item.title: 加拿大太阳能公司寻求私人信贷以加强美国业务
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在华盛顿加强对中国进口商品审查之际，加拿大太阳能公司正寻求一笔3.5亿美元的私人信贷贷款，用于扩大其在美国的市场业务。【原文：Canadian Solar Inc. is seeking a $350 million private credit loan to expand its US operations, according to people familiar with the matter, as Washington steps up scrutiny of imports from China.】

item.title: “我可不想干那份工作”：决定公用事业公司何时断电的气象学家们
item.description: 这就是在气象预报领域从事高风险工作的真实写照。【原文：This is what it’s like to work in some of the highest-stakes jobs in weather forecasting.】

item.title: 火灾风险上升促使公用事业公司采取计划性断电措施
item.description:
数据、技术和人类判断共同助力美国电力公司决定何时关闭输电线路。【原文：

Data, technology and human judgment help US power companies consider when to turn off transmission lines.

】

item.title: BNP Paribas Says It’s Appealing $21 Million Sudan Verdict
item.description: BNP Paribas SA told a US judge that it’s appealing a nearly $21 million verdict against the bank for funding a regime in Sudan that committed widespread human rights abuses.

item.title: 南非将允许犀牛、大象狩猎活动重启，此前该国已暂停此类活动六年。
item.description: 南非将首次发放猎物出口配额，为时隔约六年后重启黑犀牛、大象和豹子的狩猎活动铺平道路。【原文：South Africa will award trophy export quotas to pave the way for the hunting of black rhino, elephant and leopard for the first time in about six years.】

item.title: 双向充电如何在严寒与停电中保障电力供应
item.description: 美国目前拥有超过60万辆可在紧急情况下为家庭供电的电动汽车。【原文：The US now has more than 600,000 EVs that can feed power to houses during an emergency.】

item.title: 为何部分共和党人支持加强碳排放追踪
item.description:
随着特朗普政府试图撤销污染报告规定，部分议员认为低碳足迹将成为美国出口的竞争优势。

【原文：

As the Trump administration seeks to roll back pollution reporting rules, some lawmakers see a low carbon footprint as a competitive edge for US exports.     

】

item.title: 更多电动车型配备豪华备用电源功能以应对停电
item.description:
美国车主目前拥有超过60万辆可作为应急电源的电动汽车。

【原文：

American drivers now own more than 600,000 EVs that can serve as an emergency power source.

】

item.title: 特斯拉考虑在纽约、亚利桑那和爱达荷州扩建太阳能电池产能
item.description: 特斯拉公司并未坐等埃隆·马斯克提出的100吉瓦太阳能计划是否可行——而是已着手推进。据知情人士透露，该公司正在美国多地考察选址以启动太阳能电池生产，将几周前还被视为天方夜谭的计划转化为实际的产业布局。【原文：Tesla Inc. isn’t waiting around to see if Elon Musk’s 100-gigawatt solar ambition is feasible — it’s already acting on it. The company is evaluating multiple sites across the US to begin manufacturing solar cells, according to people familiar with the matter, turning what sounded like a moonshot just weeks ago into an active industrial push.】

item.title: 开普敦转为私营以提升电力和供水
item.description: 开普敦将公开招标实施多项重大工程，旨在降低南非第二大城市暨主要旅游枢纽的电力成本并加强水资源安全保障。【原文：Cape Town will call for tenders to implement several major projects that aim at cutting electricity costs and bolstering water security in South Africa’s second-biggest city and main tourist hub.】

item.title: 葡萄牙推出25亿欧元援助计划，致命洪灾持续蔓延
item.description: 葡萄牙政府批准了一系列紧急法案，以加速灾后重建工作。作为该国史上最大规模救灾行动之一，这项包含25亿欧元（约合29亿美元）援助计划的举措，旨在消除行政障碍。【原文：Portugal’s government approved a set of emergency laws to speed reconstruction after deadly flooding, clearing administrative hurdles as part of a €2.5 billion ($2.9 billion) support package in one of the largest disaster-relief efforts ever mobilized by the country.】

item.title: 法国极右翼人士巴尔代拉称生态是"普世价值"
item.description: 法国极右翼领袖、潜在总统候选人乔丹·巴尔代拉表示，环境问题并非左翼政党的专属领域。【原文：French far-right leader and potential presidential candidate Jordan Bardella said the environment isn’t the exclusive domain of left-wing parties.】
